headline: Gulf powers back Paramount’s $108B Hollywood grab
summary: Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Qatar join forces in $24B push to back Paramount’s $108B bid for Warner Bros Discovery. CNBC's Dan Murphy reports on the Gulf's existing media and entertainment assets.

raw.headline: Gulf powers back Paramount’s $108B Hollywood grab
raw.summary: Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Qatar join forces in $24B push to back Paramount’s $108B bid for Warner Bros Discovery. CNBC's Dan Murphy reports on the Gulf's existing media and entertainment assets.

headline: YouTube could win big as Paramount-Warner Bros. drama continues
summary: MNTN (MNTN) CEO Mark Douglas reacts to the latest media drama as Paramount Skydance (PSKY) continues to battle Netflix (NFLX) for a bid to buy Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), explaining why he thinks Alphabet's (GOOG, GOOGL) YouTube could end up winning big in the online streaming landscape. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Paramount Letter Implores Warner Bros. Shareholders: 'It's Not Too Late'
summary: Paramount Skydance CEO David Ellison urged Warner Bros. shareholders to sell their shares to his company rather than go through with the Netflix deal.

headline: Roku Stock Is a Top Pick for 2026 at 2 Wall Street Firms. Here’s Why.
summary: While  Netflix  and  Paramount Skydance  duke it out over  Warner Bros. Discovery  analysts say  Roku  stock remains an under-the-radar option in the streaming industry.  Jefferies upgraded  Roku  shares to Buy from Hold and lifted its price target to $135 from $100 in a research note Thursday.  Analysts at Wedbush Securities were on the same page.

Jefferies upgraded  Roku  shares to Buy from Hold and lifted its price target to $135 from $100 in a research note Thursday.  Analysts at Wedbush Securities were on the same page.

headline: Rosenblatt’s Barton Crockett calls Disney–OpenAI deal ‘a great endorsement’ for ChatGPT maker

headline: Warner Bros. bidding war: What is a hostile takeover?
summary: Paramount Skydance (PSKY) offered an all-cash hostile takeover bid of $30 per share to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) earlier this week, countering the company's recently announced deal with Netflix (NFLX). So, what exactly is a "hostile takeover"? Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre, who also hosts Yahoo Finance's Stocks in Translation podcast, breaks down everything you should know in the video above. Catch more Stocks in Translation, with new episodes every Tuesday and Thursday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
